intro: Pinacantha, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy, daisy-like blooms with yellow centers and white or pale pink petals. It typically grows in grassy areas and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates. Pinacantha is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
